requirements.summary: Prefill the Admin Authorization form with default credentials (admin / 1234) on initial page load while keeping both fields editable.
acceptanceCriteria: When visiting the Admin Credentials Management page and the "Admin Authorization Required" form is shown, the "Admin Login ID" input is pre-populated with "admin".
When visiting the Admin Credentials Management page and the "Admin Authorization Required" form is shown, the "Password" input is pre-populated with "1234" (masked as a password field).
The user can overwrite either prefilled value and submit the form normally.
All user-facing text remains in English.

file_operations.description: Update the initial state for the Admin Authorization form inputs so that, on first render, "Admin Login ID" is prefilled with "admin" and "Password" is prefilled with "1234" while preserving normal onChange behavior so users can edit either field before submitting. Ensure the password field remains type="password" and do not change any user-facing text.
